sentences.en: For some small unproductive mills, the reality is not merger but obsolescence and bankruptcy.
sentences.cn: 对一些效率低下的小厂而言, 现实不是合并,而是可能被淘汰和破产.

sentences.en: Loss from the sale, obsolescence, and loss of assets.
sentences.cn: 凡因资产出售 、 报废 、 及遗失等所发生之损失皆属之.

sentences.en: Obsolescence is a byarising from the use of the building.
sentences.cn: 侯选因素应该可以清楚地定义,就建筑而言逐渐陈旧是指什么.

sentences.en: Phase - out product control on material to reach the minimum obsolescence cost.
sentences.cn: 严格控制将要淘汰的产品用料,最大程度的减少报废.

sentences.en: Protect your precious email data from data format obsolescence.
sentences.cn: 保护您宝贵的电子邮件数据,从数据格式陈旧老化.

sentences.en: Requirements volatility stems largely from the rapid pace at which underlying system technologies change; this leads to early obsolescence of designs and components that might otherwise be reusable.
sentences.cn: 在底层系统技术以快速的步伐发生变化时，需求变动性就会大量地滋生；这会导致设计和组件的提早退化，否则它们是可重用的。

sentences.en: The aircraft was nearing obsolescence by early 1942.
sentences.cn: 这种飞机在1942年年初就濒临淘汰了。

sentences.en: The apparent connection between built - in obsolescence and changes in art - styles has struck several commentators.
sentences.cn: 本身过时与艺术风气改变之间存在着的显然联系,引起了一些批评家的注意.

sentences.en: the planned obsolescence of some software
sentences.cn: 某些软件的有计划报废

words.tran_cn: 荒废的；即将过时的；逐渐被废弃的

trans.tran_cn: 废弃，陈旧过时，<生>（器官的）废退
trans.tran_en: when a product is designed so that it will soon become unfashionable or impossible to use and will need replacing
